quote: ''I am pushing for (the FOI bill) one hundred and one percent. I was praying for (its approval).''
''How can you prevent a person from running (in) public (office) if that is his happiness, freedom of expression, and he wanted to be happy?''
''No [I am not in favor]. I need money for my [government] programs... to create jobs, invest in infrastructure. You need money to run this country.''
''(K)ung ako ay magiging Presidente, makakaasa kayong ang isang paa ng Bangsamoro ay nasa Malacañang na.''

YES BUT OPEN TO EXPLORATION WITH CHINA
''I will also tell them (China), do not do this in a manner of hostility. We cannot defeat you. Ma-pulverize tayo pag nagkagyera. We do not have the weapons. So I will just tell them that if you want to talk, let's talk. And I will be willing to talk to you if there is oil and gas. Let us do a joint exploration but do not claim.''
''If we will follow the presidential form of government, it will take us 40 to 50 years before we can achieve the needed reforms.''

''All human beings are created by God so kung rerespetuhin mo ang totoong babae, totoong lalaki ,at ito namang isa kung medyo alanganin sa babae, lalaki, then he is also a creation of good. So kaya magrespetuhan tayo.''
''Nandiyan na ang 4Ps, sanay na ang tao diyan. Sinasabi kasi ayaw magtrabaho eh wala naman kasi trabaho. Kaya ituloy mo ang pagkain.''
''It is difficult because the long term effect is [that] you destroy the work force. If you do that here, you destroy the economy.''

''In legal separation, there's still hope for the husband and wife to come together but not in divorce. You don't have to love your wife to live together. I'm not in favor of divorce for the sake of the children and abortion, for me, is a no-no.''
''Maski ano pa ang sabihin natin, naging Pangulo ng Pilipinas 'yan at lumaban noong World War II (North Cotabato former governor Manny Piñol quoted Rodrigo Duterte as saying).''
''It's a continuous process. We could not just... take away graft and corruption in government. But I said that we will address it.'' (Interview with InterAksyon, Jan. 20, 2016)

''By doing this (creation of business islands in the Philippines business islands for investors patterned after that of Hong Kong and Singapore), we create jobs. Filipinos will no longer go abroad to work. If we create jobs here within our borders and within our islands, then they can do business and (improve) the livelihood of the people as well.''

''It was declared by the Supreme Court to be illegal. I hope they would take their cue from the Supreme Court and... would not need the reminder from us. Pero ako, kung andyan na ako, then I would know what to do.'' (Interview with InterAksyon, Jan. 20, 2016)

''Being married and marrying the person that you love is a matter of choice. Gays are supposed to have the equal rights and freedom as heterosexuals, including the freedom to marry and build a family.''

''I am confident that with the four years, if they want to enroll in a vocational course, they can have it after high school. Huwag mong i-burden lahat just because you want to train technical people.''

''The law on land reform has expired. If ever I win, I would reinstate it. I would not go for a thing just like giving them two hectares, because most of the lands given to the beneficiaries, would you believe it, about 85 percent of those given to farmers are back in the hands of the landlords... Lahat bumalik eh. The land reform was really a faulty one. Unless you supply the farm implements, give them the fertilizers, the seedlings and even assure them of the market, because the competition of importation would kill them.''
''Let us sit down. Im not trying to be cocky but if I am the President, you (NPA rebels) come down and we'll talk.''
''If I am elected President, I will release her. Why? Because the evidence [against her] is weak. I know that. I am a lawyer.''
